storyName: Upside Down on the Pale Sea
storyInfo: Two weeks ago, Thorns, who had come to Iberia in search of a sword technique, is knocked unconscious by a saltfin, and has an unexpected encounter with Pascuala, who is being chased by a sheriff intent on executing her. After dealing with the Alguacil Anastasio, the pair head to the town of Aarón.

attributes.content: Beginning recording. My sandboard is heavily damaged, and I can't find the materials I need to repair it nearby.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: As for my water reserves... They can last me one more day, at most.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Thankfully, the next supply point is only half a day away.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: ...This many messages? Really?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: How long have I been letting them build up?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: It's been a while since we received any news from you, Operator Thorns. Remember to report your position when you have the chance.
attributes.name: Message on the Communicator

attributes.content: By my calculations, our mission routes will overlap a bit. If we can find the opportunity to meet up, I've got some spare supplies I can share.
attributes.name: Message on the Communicator

attributes.content: Hey Thorns, how's your trip to find super-ultra-cool sword techniques going? Any good news?
attributes.name: Message on the Communicator

attributes.content: Forget it... I'll reply once I'm done walking.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: This region between me and the supply point... All the map shows is a name.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: 'Mar Pálido'... The Pale Sea, huh?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Hopefully it's not a real sea.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Out in the open wilderness, sand rides along with the wind, bringing with it a salty, finny smell.
Sunlight pokes through gaps in the dark clouds, while long-dry riverbeds boast only a few bushes and shrubs.
Some rustling among them proves that this so-called wasteland is not completely devoid of life.
The young man pulls out a rope and ties together a few planks. Once done, he steps atop them and takes a leap.
All of a sudden, the wastes come to an end. A great cliff has sundered the earth.
As he looks down, Isidro sees a pallid white sea.
With all his strength, he climbs down the cliff. Once he touches down onto the pale 'sea', he reaches down and sticks a hand into the bone-dry 'seawater'.
...Salt crystals?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: There is no water here. There is only pale salt, studded with countless skeletons. The remains of whatever unlucky creatures were swallowed up by this place.
But the only thing on his mind is that somewhere, in some nook or cranny he cannot see, there is something flowing, rushing.
He stops sliding on his makeshift sandboard and reaches for the sword at his waist.
That's odd...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: How can there be anything alive here?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: The ground beneath his feet shudders slightly, and the layer of salt slowly subsides around him.
The trembling intensifies as an indentation in the salty ground approaches him at high speed.
There are fins in a Salt Flat?!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: A gigantic beast breaches the salt, catching him off guard. Its sail-like dorsal fin looms overhead, and its pointed, armored snout is shaped like a colossal lance.
It barrels into him, and he is thrown off his feet. His organs feel like they are being rearranged as he arcs through the air, before he slams into the ground and blacks out.
As his consciousness fades, he sees the giant finbeast dive back into the salt, leaving no trace in its wake.
(Good thing... it wasn't hungry...)
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: *Cough* *Cough*... Just my luck...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: That damn alguacil doesn't know when to give up. He even chased me all the way to this blasted land where nothing grows!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: *cough* Mierda... Ran too fast, all my water spilled.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: What now...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Urgh! Pleh! Bleh! This is just salt! Ptooey!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Without water, I'm not gonna make it to the town of Aarón...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Huh, what's that...?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: A gust blows past a pile of salt and dust, revealing two motionless legs sticking out from beneath it.
...Just some other unlucky soul who wandered into the Salt Flat without knowing what he was getting into.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Your bad luck is my good fortune though, amigo. Hehe.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: A full bottle of water! Excelente!
attributes.name: Pascuala
Pascuala
attributes.content: *Glug* *Glug*... *Glug*... Hah...

attributes.name: Pascuala
attributes.content: Let's see what else you've got...
attributes.joined: *Glug* *Glug*... *Glug*... Hah... Let's see what else you've got...

attributes.content: The hell're all these bottles and canisters?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Urgh! What in the BLAZES is that smell?! It stings!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Well, whether it's medicine or poison, it should still fetch a pretty penny... Rhodes Island Pharmaceuticals? Whatever, mine now.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Huh? Foreign money? What, you expected find a money changer out here? Not even fowlbeasts shit here!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Buuuut... I might have a use for it later. Mine now.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: The girl sifts through the man's wallet, finding only a few silver reales alongside some foreign coins and a meal voucher with 'Rhodes Island Cafeteria Soup Ticket' written on it.
At the bottom of the wallet, a glimmering gold coin catches her eye.
She reaches down to grab it, flipping it a few times as she retracts her hand.
On one side, there is a circle split by a horizontal line. On the other, an inverted triangle.
It's heavy... Must be pretty pure.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Wait, I feel like I've seen these patterns before... Aren't they what Juana's looking for...?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Shame. Why're you even lying out here dead anyway?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Well, you've been so generous, I can at least send you off on your final journey, amigo.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Here, have a proper burial.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: A thief is nothing but a body hollowed out by greed. They take from others for their own benefit, but satisfaction ever eludes their grasp.
The moment she hears a sword being drawn, she knows it is too late to run. She looks behind her, her body trembling as her muscles refuse to move an inch.
A cleric of the Inquisition walks towards her, his handcannon and rapier decorated with ghastly bleached bones, a deep contrast to the usual solemnity and grace of his colleagues.
All in Iberia know the sheriff's name, but also know how close to madness his mind runs. None dare call him by it to his face. Behind his back, they only ever call him by his title:
'The Alguacil'.
The unreasonable, unfeeling, uncaring Alguacil. The Alguacil that inlays his weapons with the bones of criminals as a warning.
The Alguacil that will chase a criminal to the ends of Terra and back.
I have come to free you.
W—Wait a sec, this is all a big misunderstanding!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: My head hurts... And my mouth's full of salt...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: No! I don't wanna die! Mercy!
attributes.name: Piercing Female Voice

attributes.content: Hmm...?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Aaahh! Save me!
attributes.name: Piercing Female Voice

attributes.content: What's going on?!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Why do you struggle? Your death will free you from the eternal torment of sin.
O Most Holy Señor Anastasio, please let me go! See reason, please!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Someone forced me to do it, really! I... I swear on my life! I don't even have it anymore, honest!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: If you don't believe me, search me! I don't have any compass! I-If you let me go, I'll take you to them!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: If others may impose their greed upon you, then so too will your greed corrupt others.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: All who have been tainted by avarice shall receive judgment.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: AHHH! Someone, save me! Anybody!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: The Alguacil's rapier sweeps across her face, but before it presses against her neck, a black sword swoops in from behind, knocking aside its point.
A golden liquid drips from the black sword's edge, sizzling as it eats away at the salt on the ground, an acrid scent spreading from the splash.
Run.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Th-Th-The dead guy's alive!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: I am currently arresting a criminal who has stolen a forbidden relic from the Inquisition, señor. I did not mean to disturb you during your repose.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: You're with the Inquisition?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Before you shield this vermin from justice, I pray you first ascertain if all your belongings are still on you.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: My wallet...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Your swordsmanship is impeccable. It should be used to shelter the innocent, not harbor criminals.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Geh... Mierda.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: ...What is this?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Isidro pats down his body. In the depths of his pocket, he feels something small yet hard.
An irregularly-shaped piece of metal. At first glance, it looks like detritus from a factory, but careful examination reveals the fine alchemical symbols etched all across it.
The layers of rust on it appear to have once been some kind of liquid, but even so, it shows a gleaming luster under the sunlight.
And it seems we have discovered where Señorita Pascuala hid her ill-gotten gains. Hand it to me, señor, then leave in all haste.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: This is... a 'compass' filled with Corazonix? I thought all the products of alchemy were destroyed.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Oho... And here I thought that none sinless in Iberia would yet recognize it.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: The Alguacil turns his rapier toward Isidro, his severe expression shifting towards quizzical.
You have piqued my curiosity, señor. What relation have you with the wanted criminal Aulus? Or rather, where was it you came into contact with him?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I have so many questions for you, Ægir.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: How is it you can recognize a sinful product of alchemy with but a single glance? How is it you know of a long-erased school of alchemy?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: ...It's none of your business, Alguacil.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Oh, but it very much is. You see, most of that discipline's students have died by my blade.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Isidro considers saying something, but the Alguacil's rapier is already pressing against his throat.
...So you are unwilling to submit to the law.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: The Alguacil pulls back his sword as he shifts his center of gravity forward. The blade in his hand spins once before coming down in a brutal chop.
Isidro's intuition as a swordsman tells him that this man is a lunatic. Not even the most unorthodox of fighters would wield a rapier in such a crude manner.
The cold gleam of the blade's edge flashes past his eyes. With an instinctual flick of his wrist, he blocks the savage blow.
A rapier is not made for slicing. Isidro laughs inwardly. Brandishing it like that will only cause it to snap.
But then comes a brittle screech of shattering metal, and he sees it is his own sword that has snapped in two.
Half his fractured sword is stuck point-down into the salty soil. Blood drips down his cheek.
Lay down your arms.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Run!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: The Alguacil casually brushes aside the rock the girl threw at him. The second he does so, Isidro runs off to gain some distance.
As he runs, he senses familiar vibrations coursing through the layer of salt underfoot. The pain in his jumbled organs crawls up his nerves once more.

The Alguacil's footsteps approach him as the chase continues. Isidro's mind races. He grits his teeth, and without looking back, he sets his sights on a giant skeleton in the distance poking out of the salt.
Hah, none may leave before I have the truth of the matter.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Do you always talk this much?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: (Just... a little... faster...)
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Hah...
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: As he runs from the man hounding him, Isidro holds his broken sword high, doing his utmost to fend off the Alguacil's attacks.
He looks behind his pursuer and sees the layer of salt subside, a familiar furrow appearing on the ground once more.
The Alguacil stops. He too has sensed the vibrations.
An earthquake?!
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Looks like this is your first time here too.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Before the words have finished leaving his mouth, the colossal finbeast breaches the ground in front of him, sending its prey flying.
As he flies through the air, the man's limbs splay out like a ragdoll. After a moment of soaring, his graceful arc through the sky comes to an end as he meets the ground.
A puff of salty dirt wafts through the air as the sound of his landing echoes through the dry air.
He has not fallen on the most comfortable spot in the Salt Flat. A sharp bone spur has pierced his body. His blood trickles down the skeleton, staining the pale salt below red.
Phew...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Is... Is he dead?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: If he isn't, we're in a whole lot of trouble. If he is, we're in a whole lot of trouble later.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Err... What do you mean, señor?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Did you put this thing in my pocket?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: It just fell in as I was pulling you out of that salt pile, honest!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Ahaha... Er, do you believe me?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: My pockets have zippers.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Ah, then allow me to beg forgiveness for my transgressions, señor. Still, we're both alive, right?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Why didn't you run when that alguacil was attacking me?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Would you believe me if I said I found a conscience?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Look, if you died too fast, I wouldn't be able to get very far anyway... Not to mention you still had the compass. The buyer paid a loooot of money for it.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: If I did try to book it, all that hard work would've been for nothing.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Where are you headed?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You might have been the source of my problems, but you also helped me out, so I'll return the favor.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I'll get you where you need to go, and then we're even.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Huh? 'Then we're even'... You haven't even considered going on an adventure with me?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Or we could part ways here. What you stole from me should be enough to keep you going for a while.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I... I'm heading to the town of Aarón, up on that hill over there, but it's a good two days walk from here...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Two days? Half a day should be plenty.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Huh? Really?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: The girl senses the underground vibrations closing in on them once more. A towering dorsal fin breaks through the salt and sand, rapidly approaching them.
She gawks at him incredulously, but he looks back with steely certainty.
Mind if I borrow your rope? My sandboard's broken.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Stop hitting it so much, you'll crack the wood.
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: I wanted to make it sturdier.
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: ...It's sturdy enough already. You were the one who fixed it up in the first place. Unsatisfied with your own work?
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: Señor Silver said this is how I should do my work, if I want to repent.
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: What's the sin this time?
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: The widow looks like she's about to give birth, but she won't let me look after her.
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: *sigh* She must still be haunted by my past sins that caused my wife's death. This is divine retribution.
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: I think she just doesn't want to remarry.
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: What are you talking about? It's been two years since this town has seen its last birth. I have to help take care of the child, no? I would never have such ulterior motives...
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: That's a good point. Most of the people young enough to have kids have already gone. All that's left here are us old timers.
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: Wait here and—
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: W—Wait! Over there! Santo cielo, the sky's full of salt!
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: Saltfins? Or is it a saltstorm?
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: Doesn't matter, just run! Aaaaaaaahhhhhhhhh!!!
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: The cloud of salt and dust swallows up the fleeing townsfolk as they scream in fear.

Soon after, a colossal saltfin parts the cloud, revealing two people riding on its back, one in front of the other. The young man in front pats the saltfin as he extracts a broken sword from its body.
The saltfin digs into the salt crust with its pectoral fins, giving the man a resentful glare before it departs.
He pays no mind to it, instead meeting the townsfolk's fearful gazes as he approaches them.
Sorry to trouble you, señores, but is this the town of Aarón?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Who are you? What do you want?
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: Isidro. I'm here to find something. Here, my travel pass.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Travel pass...?
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: (Quietly) Didn't Señor Silver say that nowadays there's a lot of Ægir coming ashore to help us rebuild?
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: (Quietly) Does he look like he's here to help?
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: (Quietly) All these outlanders bring with them is disaster!
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: If I'm to die today, then let me die blocking your way!
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: Huh? What are you talking about, señor?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: H—Hey, let's all calm down now. This is a misunderstanding.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: See here? This is my alguacil's badge. The higher-ups sent me and my understudy here to meet the local calificador.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Look, it's real. It looks just like Señor Silver's.
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: You... He's... He's the student?
attributes.name: Honest Townsperson

attributes.content: He... He had a growth spurt.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Can... Can Ægir even join the Inquisition?
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: ...It's all part of the plans for restoration.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: I simply cannot keep up with these changing times.
attributes.name: Distressed Townsperson

attributes.content: Uh... Thanks. Did you swipe that badge off that guy earlier?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Just asking, not judging. You don't look so good.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I can't... hold it... any longer...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Blurghhh—!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Isidro
Pascuala
attributes.content: I'm just... a bit—

attributes.name: Pascuala
attributes.content: Bleaghhh—!

attributes.name: Pascuala
attributes.content: Saltfin-sick...

attributes.name: Pascuala
attributes.content: Blurghhh—!
Between bursts of vomit, the girl stuffs the badge back into her bag.
A wayward glance shows Isidro a dozen or so of the Alguacil's belongings within bag, alongside a few bottles of his own popper potions.
He is not entirely sure when she took them off him.
...Forget it.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: We're even now. I'll be off, then.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: You're asking the wrong guy.
attributes.name: Perturbed Townsperson

attributes.content: I haven't even gotten to the question yet...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Go ask somewhere else.
attributes.name: Flustered Townsperson

attributes.content: I haven't even...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Ask someone else.
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: At least let me ask! I heard there's a local sword technique created by pirates, one that can be used to 'fight the wind and waves'. Does that sound familiar?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: P—Pirates? Santo cielo, Aarón will be ruined once more...
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: Wha...?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: It's about to rain! I need to go home to take in the laundry! Just go away! Vete!
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: ...Isn't this your house right here?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: ...Also, isn't this the driest part of Iberia?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: As he voices his doubts, he hears a clattering of footsteps behind him. He turns to see the entire street devoid of people.
As he sweeps his eyes across the street, doors and windows slam shut one after the other in raucous cacophony.
Is it actually going to rain?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.text: The lump of meat in his mouth is shriveled and dry. One of his left molars is loose and hurts like hell itself, leaving him only able to mash the meat with his right gums.
Madre had told him this was the last of the food in the house.
He thinks about how she looked as she threw it on the ground, so tender and caring. He thinks about how she looked as he picked it up, so cold and cruel.
Such contradiction. He blames the jumbled memories on the hunger.
Just as he does not remember if it was Madre who struck that molar loose, or if it was just a new one coming in.
The hunger is too great. He swallows the lump of meat and mumbles to himself.
'This is the last portion. There's none left after I eat it...'
There is the sound of a knife being sharpened from outside the door. He remembers hearing this noise... before Padre disappeared.
The ghastly truth dawns on him as he feels cold all over.
He recalls how Madre opened the door as she held the meat, a terrifying smile on her bloodstained face. She bade him open his mouth, bade him chew, bade him swallow...
He licks at the empty sockets in his gums. They had hurt, once. They don't hurt any more.
It is only because of sin that he yet lives. He should stretch out his neck and await the axe. In death, all things will be washed away.

attributes.content: The scent of dried blood upon a sharp bone spur has drawn all sorts of small, bloodthirsty beasts. They cannot stop themselves from crawling towards the gruesome wound.
First come insects bearing wings, landing upon his chin, crawling across his pale lips, then his cheek, before finally stopping atop his eyelids.
Just as they are about to enjoy their meal, the man's eyelashes begin to twitch.
Ah...
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Anastasio, you sinner. Since when was it your time to die?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Those ensnared by greed, corrupted by that compass. They yet roam free, yet commit evil.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: You must find them, purge their avarice, end their suffering.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: ...This is your duty.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: The man slowly pulls himself off the skeleton, the bone barbs and hooks tearing at his flesh as he does.
But he does not tremble in pain. Not even once.
Anastasio walks deeper into the Salt Flat. Behind him, the beasts hungrily paw at his trail of blood.
